definition: nine deaths and still alive (idiom); a narrow escape/new lease of life
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: When an accident nearly happens, we say it is a close shave .
sentences.chinese: 當車禍差一點發生的時候，我們說那是九死一生。

sentences.english: The driver escaped the death by a hair's breadth.
sentences.chinese: 那個司機這回真是九死一生。

sentences.english: It was a narrow escape, one of many he would have during his long flight.
sentences.chinese: 這真是九死一生，也是他長期飛行生涯的其中之一。

sentences.english: They, however, have little spare private time, face death every second as well.
sentences.chinese: 他們過着沒有自己時間的生活，也是九死一生的搏命。

sentences.english: She had a narrow escape from the serious disease.
sentences.chinese: 她九死一生從那次疾病中逃脫。

sentences.english: After 1955, Ding Ling was involved in the political campaign.
sentences.chinese: 1955年後，丁玲被捲入政治運動中，九死一生。

sentences.english: We escaped by a hair 's breadth.
sentences.chinese: 她九死一生從那次疾病中逃脫。

sentences.english: She described how she had narrowly escaped death.
sentences.chinese: 她敘述了她九死一生的經歷。

definition: mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
the critical moment/life and death crisis

place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: lit. mountains of daggers and seas of flames/fig. extreme danger (idiom)
